Hi,


I was wondering if somebody could point me into the
right direction on how to use junit 4 with eclipse (3.2.1),
which, according to the docs, fully supports junit 4.

My problem is that the information out there often seems to mix up
junit 3.8 and 4.0, so clarification would be very much appreciated.

I have created a test project, included the junit 4.1 jar that
ships with eclipse and included several test cases for it
using the "new junit test case" dialog. These seem to be set up
according to 4.0 style, since they use @Test attributes and do not
inherit from TestCase. I can run these cases using the "run junit
test" in the context menu.
However, I'm having problems to bundle these cases in a testsuite.

I have tried to setup a testsuite using the eclipse dialog "new
Junit Test Suite", but adding my tests to the suite in the dialog
was impossible since the textbox where I was supposed to select
my tests would not be populated.

So I generated an empty suite and tried to use
addTestSuite(MyTest.class), which would not work... I guess this
is because it is part of the 3.8 framework.


My question is hence. How am I supposed to bundle my Tests together
in general using the 4.0 way of doing things, and how can I do that
effectively using Eclipse?
Am I running into an eclipse problem or do I just not understand how
the new framework is supposed to be used?

any comments and pointers to up to date documentation would be very
much appreciated!

thanks!
Timo
